sentences.en: ‘I’m going to Appleby tomorrow.’ ‘ What a coincidence ! I’m going there too.’

sentences.en: By happy coincidence, Robert met Richard and Julia and discovered they were experiencing similar problems.
sentences.cn: 幸运的是，罗伯特碰巧遇到了理查德和朱莉娅，发现原来他们也碰到了类似的问题。

sentences.en: Does coincidence come under the umbrella of the paranormal?
sentences.cn: 巧合属于超自然现象吗？

sentences.en: Is there any coincidence between the two opinions?
sentences.cn: 这两种观点有无一致之处?

sentences.en: It is a mere coincidence that they see eye to eye on this point.

sentences.en: It is no coincidence that the works in the 'standard repertoire' tend to have names.

sentences.en: It was a coincidence that he was born on his mother's birthday.

sentences.en: It was simply one of those things, pure coincidence.

sentences.en: Mr. Berry said the timing was a coincidence and that his decision was unrelated to Mr. Roman's departure.
sentences.cn: 贝里先生说时间的安排是个巧合，而且他的决策与罗曼先生的离去毫无关系。

sentences.en: My viewpoint is in coincidence with you.
She and I both arrived at the same time by pure coincidence.

sentences.en: The premises of Chabert and Sons were situated by the river and, by coincidence, not too far away from where Eric Talbot had met his death.
sentences.cn: 查伯特父子公司的经营场所位于河边，碰巧的是，那儿离埃里克·塔尔博特身亡的地方不太远。

sentences.en: This was a frightening thing. It could not be a coincidence!

sentences.en: What an odd coincidence that he should have known your family.
sentences.cn: 他居然认识你的家人，真是太巧了。
